WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closing this... The way to specify only DW or only 2H options is to remove those you don't want from the Available Item Class menu:Tools -> Refine Types of Items Listed...
WorkItem.Description:
The DKTank module keeps insisting I use 2 Peacekeeper blades (look at Clawstrike on Undermine). The thing is:
 
1. I don't have 2 Peacekeeper blades
2. I don't want to dual wield for tanking
 
I need a way to be able to tell it to use 2H only or DW only.

Comments.Message: Edit the item to make it Unique and it won't use it twice
I tried that. It told me to use the 1H Peacekeeper with NOTHING in the other hand.

Adding to my todo list.  Though arguably, looking at SJ's numbers on tanking, DW still isn't viable.  It is viable for DPS.  What about if a 2h weapon is superior to DW?  Why would you NOT want to know that?

I honestly would prefer the flexibility of it telling me the best option given my talents, whether DW or 2H, but it's got to be right. :) And right now the results I'm getting from the DKTank module are completely bizarre. When running the optimizer for the gear I own, it seems completely obsessed with the Peacekeeper blade and that I should use it even if it's the only weapon in my hands even though it's a 1-hander. So I was pondering effective ways to deal with this problem, as what it keeps suggesting is not a viable equipment combination.

It seems to me there is probably a deeper problem here but I'm not sure what it is, and I know you have a number of work items to bring DKTank up to speed with 3.2 so I didn't want to go on about it since one or more of those might help as well.

DKDPS, oddly, has not suggested I go to DW.
What are the optimizer's other options?

Post your Character XML and I'll take a look.
Like I've mentioned in other posts, the 3.2 stuff is only partly done and not in the latest version.

Also, the optimizer method you are using may be making a difference.  So please provide your optimizer settings as well.
Is this the other file you wanted?

Ahh... I think I know what happened.  There were some errors in the code dealing w/ DW and 1-handers in my code.  Specifically around parry-haste and all that.  
In my latest build (post .13 release) when I mark Peacekeeper as unique with your setup, it now gives me Sen'jin protector in MH and Peacekeeper in the OH.  Using Bladeward on both.  Even using Swordbreaking on both is providing significant mitigation improvements.  Using the Compare Sets dialog we can see the direct changes that happen when just upgrading your rune to Stone Gargoyle improves your survival a bit and mitigation quite a bit.  

However, when running the optimizer and including RoSG - we keep the 2H with the new run and it shuffles some of your other enchants around and using the Sigil of the Unfaltering Knight and a trinket shift.  Even when I pull the Sigil out, we still see staying w/ the 2h.  

Are these the kinds of results you were more expecting?

Yes, that sounds much better than "You must use the Peacekeeper no matter what, even if it means you have nothing in the other hand." :) Do you know when the next release is coming? I'm eager to continue refining my gear post-3.2 for tanking. Or is it possible to download a copy of your current build?

I'm not in charge of the release schedule, and I am working to knock out a couple more defects over the next few days.  I don't know how the fix-rate is currently stacked.  Also, my current builds since my last post have turned gnarly since I'm in the midst of fixing these other bugs.
Guess I'll have to work on my patience skill then. ;)

Closing this... The way to specify only DW or only 2H options is to remove those you don't want from the Available Item Class menu:
Tools -> Refine Types of Items Listed...
